claims.claim: AstraZeneca's AI chest X-ray tool achieved 54.1% positive predictive value, far exceeding success threshold
claims.quote: AstraZeneca's CREATE study, presented at the European Lung Cancer Congress in March 2025, demonstrated a 54.1% positive predictive value for its AI chest X-ray tool—far exceeding the pre-defined success threshold of 20%.

claims.claim: AI screening technology deployed at national scale with over 660,000 people screened
claims.quote: Behind those numbers: over 660,000 people screened in Thailand since 2022, with AI detecting suspected pulmonary lesions in 8% of cases.

claims.claim: Thailand scaling AI technology across 887 hospitals with 415 million baht budget
claims.quote: Thailand's National Health Security Office is now scaling this technology across 887 hospitals with a three-year budget exceeding 415 million baht.

claims.claim: AI protocol tool reduced document authoring time by 85%
claims.quote: It's an 'intelligent protocol tool,' developed with medical writers, that has reduced document authoring time by 85% in some cases.

claims.claim: AI-discovered drugs achieve 80-90% Phase I success rates versus 40-65% traditional benchmark
claims.quote: AI-discovered drugs achieve 80-90% Phase I success rates—double the 40-65% traditional benchmark.

claims.claim: Sites using StudyTeam randomize more patients per site per month
claims.quote: Sites using StudyTeam with AstraZeneca randomize more patients per site per month and provide overwhelmingly positive feedback

claims.claim: 100% of sites using StudyTeam choose to continue using it for subsequent studies
claims.quote: in fact, 100% of sites using StudyTeam in its trials choose to do so for subsequent studies.

claims.claim: AstraZeneca aims to deliver 20 new medicines by 2030 through AI acceleration
claims.quote: AstraZeneca, a global biopharmaceutical company, embarked on an ambitious initiative to leverage AI for accelerating drug development as part of their broader corporate goal to deliver 20 new medicines by 2030.
